conbody.p:
event frameworkexecutorsExecutors perform tasks when they receive event records. You can use the following executor stages for event handling:
Hive Query executor Executes user-defined Hive or Impala queries for each event. Use with the Hive Metadata destination to run Hive or Impala queries after Hive metastore updates. You can also use the executor with the Hadoop FS or MapR FS destinations to run queries after closing files. For example, you might use the Hive Query executor as part of the Drift Synchronization Solution for Hive if you read data with Impala. Impala requires you to run the Invalidate Metadata command when the table structure or data changes. Instead of trying to time this action manually, you can use the Hive Query executor to submit the command automatically each time the Hive Metastore destination changes the structure of a table and each time the Hadoop FS destination closes a file.
HDFS File Metadata executor Connects to HDFS, MapR FS, or a local file system and performs file-based tasks for each event. Can rename, move, and define the owner, group, permissions and ACLs for files. Use with the Hadoop FS, Local FS, and MapR FS destinations, which generate events when they close an output file or finish streaming a whole file. For example, you can use the HDFS File Metadata executor with the Local FS destination to move and change the permissions of files when the destination closes a file.
JDBC Query executor Connects to a database using JDBC and runs the specified SQL query. Use to run a SQL query on a database after an event occurs.
MapReduce executor Connects to HDFS or MapR FS and starts a MapReduce job for each event. Use with the Hadoop FS or MapR FS destinations to run MapReduce jobs on closed files. For example, you can use the MapReduce executor with the Hadoop FS destination to convert Avro files to Parquet when Hadoop FS closes a file.
Spark executor Connects to Spark on YARN or Databricks and starts a Spark application for each event. Use with the Hadoop FS, MapR FS, or Amazon S3 destination to run Spark applications on closed files. For example, you can use the Spark executor with the Hadoop FS destination to convert Avro files to Parquet when Hadoop FS closes a file.
